post.summary: Start a new inspection
Generate a deep link for an inspection
post.description: Generate a URL to the inspection with the supplied inspection ID. The link will open in the iAuditor mobile application if clicked on a mobile device with the iAuditor app installed. Otherwise it will open the inspection in the iAuditor web application.

parameters.name: audit_id
parameters.description: The id of the inspection to retrieve a deep link for.

post.summary: Share an inspection to the specified user or group.

parameters.name: audit_id
parameters.description: The id of the inspection to share.

shares.description: The users and groups to share with.

get.summary:
Retreive the web report link for the specified inspection. This will return
the existing link if one has been generated before, or generate a new one
if one does not exist already.
</br></br>
This link does not expire, it is valid until deleted.

parameters.name: audit_id
parameters.description: The id of the inspection to retrieve a web report link for.

delete.summary:
Delete the web report link for an inspection. Doing this will prevent
previously shared links from working.

parameters.name: audit_id
parameters.description: The id of the inspection to delete a web report link for.

post.summary: Create a folder

delete.summary: Remove association for multiple users to a specific folder

parameters.name: folder_id
parameters.description: Required. The folder identifier we want to remove users from

parameters.name: user_ids
parameters.description:
Required. List of User IDs to remove association to given folder
For example: '[user_5441fffcde344415bb7ccaceda27e196,
user_6441fffcde344415bb7ccaceda27e196]'

post.summary: Associate multiple users access to a specific folder

parameters.name: folder_id
parameters.description: Required. The folder identifier we want to associate users to

user_ids.title:
Required. List of User IDs to associate to given folder
For example: '[user_5441fffcde344415bb7ccaceda27e196,
user_6441fffcde344415bb7ccaceda27e196]'

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: Required. The folder identifier to retrieve info for

parameters.name: with_ancestors
parameters.description: When true, an array of the folders ancestors will also be returned.

parameters.name: with_all_children_count
parameters.description:
When true, the total count of all children underneath the folder will be
returned. This is a recursive count and will include children of children

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: Required. The folder identifier of the folder to be updated.

domain.title:
domain represents the type/domain/hierarchy for the folder. This is
used for changing the properties of a specific domain folder

get.summary:
Retrieve users associated to a folder, includes both directly and
indirectly (inherited)

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: Required. The folder identifier we want to get all the users for

parameters.name: get_users_of_descendants
parameters.description:
Optional. When true, it will return all of the members of a specified folder
and its children folders recursively. Default false, will return all of the
members of a specified folder and its parent/ancestor folders.

get.summary: Retrieve users directly associated to a folder

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: Required. The folder identifier we want to get the users for

get.summary: Retrieve users indirectly associated (inherited) to a folder

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: Required. The folder identifier we want to get the users for

parameters.name: page_size
parameters.description:
Required. This determines the max number of folders returned in the
response.

parameters.name: page_token
parameters.description:
Optional. base64 encoded. If this field is present, the list of folders
returned will start from the row after this token.

parameters.name: order_by.sort_field
parameters.description:
The field to order by

 - SORT_FIELD_UNSPECIFIED: The sort field is unspecified
 - SORT_FIELD_NAME: Sort the folder by name
 - SORT_FIELD_FOLDER_ID: Sort the folders by folder id
 - SORT_FIELD_USER_ID: Sort the folders by user id
 - SORT_FIELD_CREATED_AT: Sort the folders by created at
 - SORT_FIELD_MODIFIED_AT: Sort the folders by modified at

parameters.name: order_by.sort_order
parameters.description:
The direction to order by

 - SORT_ORDER_UNSPECIFIED: The sort order is not specified
 - SORT_ORDER_ASCENDING: The sort order is asc
 - SORT_ORDER_DESCENDING: The sort order is desc

parameters.name: only_leaf_nodes
parameters.description:
Optional. When true, GetFolders will only return leaf node folders. leaf
nodes are folders that do not have children  Defaults to false.

parameters.name: with_ancestors
parameters.description:
Optional. When true, folders will be returned with a list of their
ancestors as well. Defaults to false

parameters.name: include_deleted
parameters.description: When true, deleted folders will also be returned

parameters.name: ignore_folders_disabled
parameters.description:
Optional. When true, folders will still be returned when disabled for the
organisation

parameters.name: domain
parameters.description:
domain represents the type/domain/hierarchy for the folder. This is used
for getting folders of a certain domain, i.e. getting all `template`
folders or `site` folders

parameters.name: folder_ids
parameters.description: Required. Folder ids of the folders to be deleted

parameters.name: cascade_up
parameters.description:
Deleting folders will always cascade down. If a parent is deleted, then all
of its children are deleted. When cascade_up is true, if a child is
deleted, and it's parent no longer has any children, then it will be
deleted too. This will cascade all the way up the tree.

parameters.name: domain
parameters.description:
domain represents the type/domain/hierarchy for the folder. This is used
for deleting folders within a specified domain

get.summary: Lists Schedule Items for the authorized user

parameters.name: page_size
parameters.description:
Number of messages to be returned in a single request. Maximun
100. Non-positive values are ignored.  The presence of `next_page_token` in
the response indicates that more results might be available. For example:
'20'

parameters.name: page_token
parameters.description:
If present, then retrieve the next batch of results from the
preceding call to this method.  `page_token` must be the value of
`next_page_token` from the previous response.  The values of other method
parameters should be identical to those in the previous call.
For example: 'MzA='

parameters.name: statuses
parameters.description:
Filter ScheduleItems to those with one of the the given status

 - STATUS_UNSPECIFIED: Unspecified status value
 - ACTIVE: Default value - schedule item is still active
 - PAUSED: Schedule has been paused e.g. manually paused/org frozen
 - NO_TEMPLATE: The template used for this schedule item has been deleted/archived
 - NO_ASSIGNEE: No valid assignees exist for this schedule item anymore
 - FINISHED: The schedule item has hit its end date or count limit and is now complete

post.summary: Creates a new Schedule Item

requestBody.description: The schedule item to be created

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The id of the schedule item to update

issues that the user has access to will be returned.

status_id.description:
Required. The ID of the status you are updating the task to.
An incident can be open or resolved, and these are represented by hardcoded
UUID values.
Open status: `547ed646-5e34-4732-bb54-a199d304368a`.
Resolved status: `450484b1-56cd-4784-9b49-a3cf97d0c0ad`.

modified_at.description: Optional. The UTC time and date the modification took place.

@type.description:
A URL/resource name that uniquely identifies the type of the serialized
protocol buffer message. This string must contain at least
one "/" character. The last segment of the URL's path must represent
the fully qualified name of the type (as in
`path/google.protobuf.Duration`). The name should be in a canonical form
(e.g., leading "." is not accepted).

In practice, teams usually precompile into the binary all types that they
expect it to use in the context of Any. However, for URLs which use the
scheme `http`, `https`, or no scheme, one can optionally set up a type
server that maps type URLs to message definitions as follows:

* If no scheme is provided, `https` is assumed.
* An HTTP GET on the URL must yield a [google.protobuf.Type][]
  value in binary format, or produce an error.
* Applications are allowed to cache lookup results based on the
  URL, or have them precompiled into a binary to avoid any
  lookup. Therefore, binary compatibility needs to be preserved
  on changes to types. (Use versioned type names to manage
  breaking changes.)

Note: this functionality is not currently available in the official
protobuf release, and it is not used for type URLs beginning with
type.googleapis.com.

Schemes other than `http`, `https` (or the empty scheme) might be
used with implementation specific semantics.

red.description: The amount of red in the color as a value in the interval [0, 255].

green.description: The amount of green in the color as a value in the interval [0, 255].

blue.description: The amount of blue in the color as a value in the interval [0, 255].

s12.common.Color.title:
Color represents a color representation of given option and is decimal
representation of RGB

s12.common.GeoPosition.description: A position is the fundamental geographical geometry construct.

filename.title: full file name, including file extension

s12.common.MediaType.title:
- MEDIA_TYPE_NONE_UNSPECIFIED: none/unspecified type for legacy cases
defaults to the image type
 - MEDIA_TYPE_IMAGE: image media type
 - MEDIA_TYPE_VIDEO: video media type
 - MEDIA_TYPE_PDF: PDF media type
 - MEDIA_TYPE_DOCUMENT: @deprecated: Use MEDIA_TYPE_PDF instead for PDFs
document media type

s12.common.TemperatureUnit.description:
- UNKNOWN_TEMPERATURE_UNIT: Represents an Unknown temperature unit
 - KELVIN: Represents Kelvin temperature unit
 - CELSIUS: Represents Celsius temperature unit
 - FAHRENHEIT: Represents Fahrenheit temperature unit
s12.common.TemperatureUnit.title: Represents different units to measure temperature

s12.common.UUIDValue.description: Wrapper message for a string representation of a `UUID`.

folder_status.title:
Map of folders ids with their resulting status after being associated to
the user. This map is populated with the list of folders
passed in through the `AddFoldersAssociationRequest`
For example: <Key,Value> -> <5441fffcde344415bb7ccaceda27e196,
Status>

revoked_membership_folder_ids.description:
An array of folder ids that the user has lost direct membership of. Being a
member of a parent folder is the same as being a member of the child, so we
remove this association.

s12.directory.v1.AddFoldersAssociationRe.description:
- UNKNOWN: Status unknown
 - ADDED: Folder was successfully associated to the user
 - DUPLICATE: Folder has already been associated to the user
 - FAILED: Failed to associate folder to the user
 - STATUS_ALREADY_MEMBER_OF_PARENT: Not added to folder, because user is already a member of a parent folder
 - STATUS_ADDED_AND_REMOVED_FROM_CHILDREN: User was added, and removed from this folders child folders
s12.directory.v1.AddFoldersAssociationRe.title: Resulting status values after associating a folder and user

user_status.title:
Map of users ids with their resulting status after associating with
the requested folder. This map is populated with the list of users
passed in through the `AddUsersAssociationRequest`
For example: <Key,Value> -> <5441fffcde344415bb7ccaceda27e196,
UserStatus>

revoked_user_memberships.description:
Map of user ids with an array of folder_ids that they have lost direct
membership to. Being a member of a parent folder is the same as being a
member of the child, so we remove this association.

s12.directory.v1.AddUsersAssociationResp.description:
- UNKNOWN: Status unknown for user
 - ADDED: User was successfully associated to the folder
 - DUPLICATE: User has already been associated to the folder
 - STATUS_MEMBER_OF_PARENT: User is already a member of a parent folder
 - STATUS_ADDED_AND_REMOVED_FROM_CHILDREN: User was successfully associated to the folder, and removed from children
folders
s12.directory.v1.AddUsersAssociationResp.title: Resulting status values after associating a user to a folder

name.description: Required. Non-empty folder name. Limited to maximum 250 characters.

parent_id.title:
Optional. Parent folder UUID. If unspecified, will be created as a root
folder

id.description: Optional. Folder UUID. If unspecified, backend will generate the ID.

meta_label.description:
Optional. Folder meta label. If unspecified, backend will assign an empty
string meta label. Limited to maximum 250 characters.

domain.title:
domain represents the type/domain/hierarchy for the folder. This is used
for getting folders of a certain domain, i.e. getting all `template`
folders or `site` folders

id.title:
An unique identifier for the folder. Must be a valid UUID.
For example: '00001d65-d336-485a-8331-7b53f37e8f51'

org_id.title: The organisation that the folder belongs to

creator_id.title:
The user id responsible for creating the folder
For example: 'user_5441fffcde344415bb7ccaceda27e196'

created_at.title:
The creation timestamp of the folder (Date, Time, Timezone)
For example: '2020-04-28T04:14:31:00Z'

modified_at.title:
The timestamp of the last modification for the folder (Date, Time,
Timezone) For example: '2020-04-28T04:14:00Z'

meta_label.title:
Additional meta information that can be associated with the folder
e.g. 'location'

members_count.description: Members count are the count of active users associated with the folder.

deleted.description: Whether a folder has been marked as deleted or not.

s12.directory.v1.Folder.description: Folder represents the main directory object
s12.directory.v1.Folder.title: Folder

folders.title: The list of folders in the message

s12.directory.v1.FolderList.description: FolderList represents an array of folders
s12.directory.v1.FolderList.title: FolderList

ancestors.title:
The folders ancestors. For example, when returning a `location` leaf node,
the ancestors will be the [`area`,`region`] folders, when applicable

members_count.description: Members count are the count of active users associated with the folder.

has_children.title: Whether the folder has children or not

s12.directory.v1.FolderWithAncestors.description: FolderWithAncestors represents a a folder with an array of ancestor folders
s12.directory.v1.FolderWithAncestors.title: FolderWithAncestors

user_ids.title:
The list of user_ids that have explict and inherited access to the
requested folder

folder_ids.title:
List of folder IDs the user has access to.
For example: '5441fffcde344415bb7ccaceda27e196'

ancestors.title:
When with_ancestors is true, an array of the folders ancestors will be
returned. The array will be ordered, closest ancestor to furthest

all_children_count.title:
The total count of children underneath the folder. I
Including children of children recursively

member_count.title: The number of directly assigned users

deleted.title: Whether the folder is deleted or not

folders.description: The list of folders belonging to the organisation specified in the request.

next_page_token.description:
Optional. base64 encoded. If this field is present, the value should be
used in subsequent calls to GetFolders to get the next page of results.
Otherwise, no further calls should be made.

folders_with_ancestors.title:
When with_ancestors is true, folders with ancestors will be returned
instead of an array of folders

folders_enabled.description: Whether or not the org settings setting is enabled.

user_folders.title:
Map of users (keys) with their ancestor folder assignments (values). This
map is populated with the list of users that have inherited access to the
specified folder. In addition, the list of folders per user is ordered from
highest to lowest ancestor. For example: <Key,Value> -> //
<user_5441fffcde344415bb7ccaceda27e196, [List of folders]>

user_ids.title: The list of user IDs that have explict access to the specified folder

folder_status.title:
Map of folders ids with their resulting status after removing the user
access to that folder. This map is populated with the list of folders
passed in through the `RemoveFoldersAssociation`
For example: <Key,Value> -> <5441fffcde344415bb7ccaceda27e196,
Status>

s12.directory.v1.RemoveFoldersAssociatio.description:
- UNKNOWN: Status unknown
 - REMOVED: Folder was successfully removed from the user
 - NOT_FOUND: Folder user association was not found
s12.directory.v1.RemoveFoldersAssociatio.title: Resulting status values after removing a folder from a user

user_status.title:
Map of users ids with their resulting status after removing access
to the requested folder. This map is populated with the list of users
passed in through the `RemoveUsersAssociation`
For example: <Key,Value> -> <5441fffcde344415bb7ccaceda27e196,
Status>

s12.directory.v1.RemoveUsersAssociationR.description:
- UNKNOWN: Status unknown for user
 - REMOVED: User was successfully removed from the folder
 - NOT_FOUND: User folder association was not found
s12.directory.v1.RemoveUsersAssociationR.title: Resulting status values after removing a user from a folder

timezone.title: Sets the timezone for bulk exporting file name

regenerate.description:
Indicate whether to by pass any caching and regenerate the report from the
lastest data. This flag would only take effect for authorized user.

s12.reports.v1.StartInspectionExportRequ.title:
- DOCUMENT_TYPE_PDF: export document as PDF
 - DOCUMENT_TYPE_WORD: export document as MS Word

inspection_id.title: The ID of the inspection, this can be an s12ID or a UUID

lang.title:
Sets the language for the document using language code from ISO-639
format

pages.title: Sets the pages need to be hid for the generated document

s12.reports.v1.StartInspectionExportRequ.description: Export data contains all export variant for a single inspection
s12.reports.v1.StartInspectionExportRequ.title: StartInspectionExportRequest.ExportData

url.title:
The S3 bucket url for the generated export file, the url will only be
populated when the status is 'DONE'

info.title: Any additional info that feedback to the calling service

subject.title: The code for a particular subject

details.title: Any additional details for the particular subject

id.title: The id of the newly created schedule item

next_page_token.title:
If there might be more results than those appearing in this response, then
`next_page_token` is included. If empty then there are no more results.
To get the next set of results, call this
method again using the value of `next_page_token` as `page_token`.
For Example: 'MzA='

can_late_submit.title: Can the inspections be started after the due date

recurrence.description:
[RRule](https://www.textmagic.com/free-tools/rrule-generator) formatted recurrence string.
Example: `FREQ=WEEKLY;BYDAY=MO;INTERVAL=1` represents weekly on Monday.

duration.description:
ISO8601 duration string, e.g. PT1H. How long inspection can be started
after the start_date.

timezone.title: Timezone the schedule item will appear in

from_date.title: When this schedule will begin appearing

reminders.title: Reminders that will be sent to assignees

modified_at.title: When the schdule item was last modified

created_at.title: When the schdule item was created

assignees.title: The users or groups that are assigned to complete the schedule

location_id.title: The location assigned to this schedule item

s12.schedules.v1.ScheduleItem.description: ScheduleItem represents a the rule for a reoccuring schedule event
s12.schedules.v1.ScheduleItem.title: ScheduleItem

id.title: The unique identifier for the document

s12.schedules.v1.ScheduleItem.Document.description: Document represents the document in a schedule
s12.schedules.v1.ScheduleItem.Document.title: ScheduleItem.Document

s12.schedules.v1.ScheduleItem.DocumentTy.description:
- DOCUMENT_TYPE_UNSPECIFIED: Unspecified document type
 - TEMPLATE: Inspection Template
s12.schedules.v1.ScheduleItem.DocumentTy.title: DocumentType is the type of document (e.g. template)

id.title: The unique identifier for the entity

s12.schedules.v1.ScheduleItem.Entity.description: Entity represent the entity in a schedule, either creator or assignee
s12.schedules.v1.ScheduleItem.Entity.title: ScheduleItem.Entity

s12.schedules.v1.ScheduleItem.EntityType.description:
- ENTITY_TYPE_UNSPECIFIED: Unspecified entity type
 - USER: User
 - ROLE: Role
s12.schedules.v1.ScheduleItem.EntityType.title: EntityType is the type of entity, either a user or a role

s12.schedules.v1.ScheduleItem.MustComple.description:
- MUST_COMPLETE_UNSPECIFIED: Unspecified must complete value
 - ONE: Schedule must be completed by one assignee
 - ALL: Schedule must be completed by all assignees
s12.schedules.v1.ScheduleItem.MustComple.title:
MustComplete is whom must complete a given schedule, either one assignee or
all assignees

start.title: The ISO8601 timestamp when the next occurrence will occur

due.title: The ISO8601 timestamp when the next occurrence is due by

s12.schedules.v1.ScheduleItem.NextOccurr.description: NextOccurrence is the next time the schedule item will occur for assignees
s12.schedules.v1.ScheduleItem.NextOccurr.title: ScheduleItem.NextOccurrence

duration.description:
ISO8601 duration string, e.g. PT1H. How long before the event to remind
the assignees.

s12.schedules.v1.ScheduleItem.Reminder.description: Reminder represents a reminder for a schedule item
s12.schedules.v1.ScheduleItem.Reminder.title: ScheduleItem.Reminder

s12.schedules.v1.ScheduleItem.ReminderEv.description:
- REMINDER_EVENT_TYPE_UNSPECIFIED: Unspecified reminder event type
 - START: Default value - start of the schedule
 - DUE: End of the schedule
s12.schedules.v1.ScheduleItem.ReminderEv.title: ReminderEventType is the type of reminder event

hour.title: The hour of the day to start the schedule

minute.title: The minute of the day to start the schedule

s12.schedules.v1.ScheduleItem.StartTime.description: StartTime represents the start time of a schedule item
s12.schedules.v1.ScheduleItem.StartTime.title: ScheduleItem.StartTime

s12.schedules.v1.ScheduleItem.Status.description:
- STATUS_UNSPECIFIED: Unspecified status value
 - ACTIVE: Default value - schedule item is still active
 - PAUSED: Schedule has been paused e.g. manually paused/org frozen
 - NO_TEMPLATE: The template used for this schedule item has been deleted/archived
 - NO_ASSIGNEE: No valid assignees exist for this schedule item anymore
 - FINISHED: The schedule item has hit its end date or count limit and is now complete
s12.schedules.v1.ScheduleItem.Status.title: Status is the current status of the schedule item

s12.tasks.v1.Action.title: Action represents a stand-alone action that has been created

next_page_token.title:
If there might be more results than those appearing in this response, then
`next_page_token` is included. If empty then there are no more results.
To get the next set of results, call this
method again using the value of `next_page_token` as `page_token`.
For Example: 'ODFBMzQ3MDYtNzQxNy00RDZGLThDNjE1MEFDMkM4MTQ3NDQ='

task_id.description: Required. The UUID for the task the comment is being added to.

comment.description: Required. The content of the comment.

created_at.description: Optional. Date/time this comment was added.

event_id.description:
Optional. The unique identifier for the event. This will be auto-generated
if omitted.

s12.tasks.v1.AlertEventLevel.description:
- UNKNOWN_LEVEL: `UNKNOWN` indicates null value
 - OK: `OK` level indicates that device metric became healthy
 - INFO: `INFO` level indicates that the first alert event sent
 - WARN: `WARN` level indicates that the second alert event sent
 - CRITICAL: `CRITICAL` level indicates that the third alert event sent
s12.tasks.v1.AlertEventLevel.title: Alert event level represents a level of importance of the alert event

key.description:
The name of a category. This can be a default name or one that is
customized in your organization.

label.description:
The name of a category. This field's value is the same as the value for
`key`.

description.description:
The description of a category. This is unused, and is hardcoded to an empty
string, `""`.

display_order.description:
The sorting order of a list of categories. This is unused, and is hardcoded
as `0`.

is_visible.description:
The indicator for whether a category is visible or not for an organization
on the web app and the mobile app.

use_category_access_whitelist.description:
The indicator for whether a category's issues can be accessed by anyone
in your organization or not. If this is `false` for a category, then that
category's issues can only be accessed by creators and assignees.

s12.tasks.v1.Category.description:
A category is used to classify an issue.
For example, you can filter issues by category for analytics, or give
users or groups access to issues from a category.

s12.tasks.v1.CollaboratorRole.description:
- COLLABORATOR_ROLE_NOT_SET: The default value for when a collaborator role is not set.
 - ASSIGNEE: The collaborator has been assigned to a task.
 - CREATOR: The collaborator has created the task.
s12.tasks.v1.CollaboratorRole.title: The role of the collaborator in relation to a task

s12.tasks.v1.CollaboratorType.description:
- COLLABORATOR_TYPE_NOT_SET: The default value for when the collaborator type is not set.
 - USER: The collaborator is an internal user.
 - GROUP: The collaborator is a group.
 - EXTERNAL_USER: The collaborator is an external user.
This happens when a task is assigned to an email address.
 - CONTRIBUTOR: The collaborator is a contributor.
A contributor is an individual who raises a task anonymously. For example,
creating an incident through the incident QR code functionality.
s12.tasks.v1.CollaboratorType.title: The type of the collaborator

task_id.title:
Optional. The unique identifier of the action
If not provided, UUID will be generated server side

title.title:
Required. Title of the action
Title is limited to only 255 characters max

description.title: Optional. Description of the action (maximum 500 characters)

collaborators.title: The collaborators involved into this action

priority_id.title:
Optional. ID of the action's priority
If not set, this action will be stored with the default priority(none)

status_id.title:
Optional. ID of the action's status
If not set, this action will be stored with the default status(to do)

created_at.title: Optional. Date and time this action was created

due_at.title: Optional. Date/time this action is due

inspection_id.description:
Optional. ID of the inspection the action belongs to
If not set, this action is a standalone action and the inspection ID will
be null.

inspection_item_id.title: Optional. ID of the item in the inspection associated with the action

template_id.description:
Optional. If a template ID is provided then an inspection ID must be
provided. If not set, this action is a standalone action and the template
ID will be null.

site_id.title: Optional. ID of the Site associated with the action

references.description: Optional. Array of references attached to this action.

task_id.description:
A UUID to identify the issue.
Optional. If it is not provided, it will be automatically generated.

title.description: Required. Title of the issue (maximum 255 characters).

description.description: Optional. Description of the issue (maximum 500 characters).

collaborators.description:
The collaborators involved in this issue.
Collaborators are users who have been assigned to the issue. The user will
appear in the "Assignee" field in the issue. Only one user can be assigned
to an issue at a time.

created_at.description:
Optional. The date and time this issue was created.
If no date is provided, the current time will be used.
Must be sent in RFC3339 format, more information about the type is
available here:
https://developers.google.com/protocol-buffers/docs/reference/google.protobuf#timestamp.

category_id.description:
The ID of the issue's category.
Categories are configured at an organization level, and can be retrieved
from the `GetCategories` endpoint. The issue will not be created if the
category is missing, and an error will be returned.

status_id.description:
Optional. ID of the issue's status.
If not set, this issue will be stored with the default status (Open).
An issue can be open or resolved, and these are represented by hardcoded
UUID values. Open status: `547ed646-5e34-4732-bb54-a199d304368a`. Resolved
status: `450484b1-56cd-4784-9b49-a3cf97d0c0ad`.

site_id.description:
The ID of the site associated with the issue.
Site IDs can be retrieved on platform.

ids.title: The list of action ids to be deleted

modified_at.description: Optional. The UTC time and date the deletion took place.

s12.tasks.v1.DeleteActionsRequest.title: DeleteActionsRequest represents the list of action ids to delete

ids.description: The list of issue UUIDs to be deleted.

modified_at.description: Optional. The UTC time and date the deletion took place.

s12.tasks.v1.DeleteIncidentsRequest.description: DeleteIncidentsRequest represents the list of issue UUIDs to delete.

url.description: The shareable link pointing to the issue's public web report.

page_size.title:
Optional. Number of actions to be returned in a single request. Maximum
100. Non-positive values are ignored. The presence of `next_page_token` in
the response indicates that more results might be available. For example:
'20'

page_token.title:
Optional. If present, then retrieve the next batch of results from the
preceding call to this method. `page_token` must be the value of
`next_page_token` from the previous response.  The values of other method
parameters should be identical to those in the previous call.
For example: 'ODFBMzQ3MDYtNzQxNy00RDZGLThDNjE1MEFDMkM4MTQ3NDQ='

inspection_id.description:
Optional. The ID of the inspection the action belongs to. Depricated,
inspectionID in `filters` should be used instead.

offset.description: Optional. Offset from where on the actions will be listed.

filters.title: Optional. Filters consists of an array of filter for listing actions

modified_before.title: optional, filters out anything modified after this date

modified_after.title: optional, filters out anything modified before this date

s12.tasks.v1.GetActionsRequest.Filter.title:
Filters represents a filters object which contains the filters
for listing actions

value.title:
OR relation, represents the assignee_id should be one of the value
provided

OR relation, represents the assignee_id should be one of the value
provided

OR relation, represents the creator_id should be
one of the value provided

s12.tasks.v1.GetActionsRequest.Filter.Fi.title:
- EQ: field value = given value
 - GTE: field value >= given value
 - GT: field value > given value
 - LTE: field value <= given value
 - LT: field value < given value
 - CONTAINS: field value contains given value
 - IN: field value in given values

value.title:
OR relation, represents the inspection_id should be
one of the value provided

OR relation, represents the inspection_item_id should be
one of the value provided

OR relation, represents the priority_id should be one of the value
provided

term.description: `term` represents the text to search for.

value.title: OR relation, represents the site_id should be one of the value provided

OR relation, represents the status_id should be one of the value
provided

OR relation, represents the template_id should be one of the value
provided

represents the time should be
after the value provided

represents the time should be
before the value provided

categories.title: A list of the categories that are configured for the organisation

s12.tasks.v1.GetCategoriesResponse.description:
GetCategoriesResponse represents the response to a GetCategories request.
It is an array of `Category`, containing data about the organization's
categories.

page_size.description:
Optional. Number of issues to be returned in a single request.
This must be a value between 1 and 100, any values outside of this range
will be ignored. The presence of `next_page_token` in the response
indicates that more results might be available.

page_token.title:
Optional. If present, then retrieve the next batch of results from the
preceding call to this method. `page_token` must be the value of
`next_page_token` from the previous response.  The values of other method
parameters should be identical to those in the previous call.
This can be used to retrieve more than 100 issues with multiple API
calls. For example: 'ODFBMzQ3MDYtNzQxNy00RDZGLThDNjE1MEFDMkM4MTQ3NDQ='

filters.description:
Optional. An array of filters can be provided in the request to filter the
issues.

s12.tasks.v1.GetIncidentsRequest.Filter.description:
Filters represents a filters object which contains the filters available
when listing issues. You can provide an array of filters in the request
to get a more specific response. Each filter can have an `operator` and a
`value`. The `operators` are described in `FilterOperator`, and the `value`
will be a UUID associated with that filter type.

value.description: The user ID of the assignee.

s12.tasks.v1.GetIncidentsRequest.Filter..description:
Will return issues where the user ID of the assignee matches the
provided value.
Will return issues that have a matching category.

value.description: The user ID of the creator.

s12.tasks.v1.GetIncidentsRequest.Filter..description:
Will return issues where the user ID of the creator matches the
provided value.

The options available when defining a filter. The only available option
is `IN`.

 - FILTER_OPERATOR_UNKNOWN: `FILTER_OPERATOR_UNKNOWN` represents the default value for a filter
operator, which is `IN`.
 - IN: `IN` returns results where the value is a direct match.

Will return issues that have a matching priority.
The priority of an issue can be one of four options: none, low, medium
or high. Each of these are represented by a hardcoded UUID value.
No priority: `58941717-817f-4c7c-a6f6-5cd05e2bbfde`.
Low priority: `16ba4717-adc9-4d48-bf7c-044cfe0d2727`.
Medium priority: `ce87c58a-eeb2-4fde-9dc4-c6e85f1f4055`.
High priority: `02eb40c1-4f46-40c5-be16-d32941c96ec9`.

term.description: `term` represents the text to search for.

s12.tasks.v1.GetIncidentsRequest.Filter..description:
Will return issues where the title and/or description contain the search
term.
Will return issues that have a matching site.

Will return issues that have a matching status.
An issue can be open or resolved, and these are represented by
hardcoded UUID values.
Open status: `547ed646-5e34-4732-bb54-a199d304368a`.
Resolved status: `450484b1-56cd-4784-9b49-a3cf97d0c0ad`.

s12.tasks.v1.GetIncidentsRequest.SortDir.description:
The options available to define the sort direction.

 - SORT_DIRECTION_UNKNOWN: `SORT_DIRECTION_UNKNOWN` will return the default sort direction.
 - ASC: `ASC` will return the sorted issues in ascending order.
 - DESC: `DESC` will return the sorted issues in descending order.

s12.tasks.v1.GetIncidentsRequest.SortFie.description:
The options available to sort the issues by.
By default, the issues will be returned by the date they were last
modified in descending order. This should be used in combination with
`SortDirection` to determine how issues are sorted. If either
`SortField` or `SortDirection` is missing, the default sort order will be
used.

 - SORT_FIELD_UNKNOWN: `SORT_FIELD_UNKNOWN` will return the default sort order.
 - PRIORITY: `PRIORITY` will sort the issues by incident priority.
 - DATE_DUE: `DATE_DUE` will sort the issues by due date.
 - CREATED_AT: `CREATED_AT` will sort the issues by the date they were created.
 - MODIFIED_AT: `MODIFIED_AT` will sort the issues by the date they were last
modified.

task_id.description: Required. The UUID of the task whose timeline will be retrieved.

timeline_items.description: A list of items in the task timeline.

s12.tasks.v1.Group.title: Group represents a user group configured within an organisation

category_id.description:
@deprecated. Use category instead.
The category id associated with the issue.

media.description: Any media associated with this issue.

inspections.description: The inspections that are linked to this issue.

s12.tasks.v1.Incident.description:
An Incident represents the details of an issue.
This can include the category, any attached media, the location,
any linked inspections and the task associated with the issue.

next_page_token.title:
If there are more results than those appearing in this response, then
`next_page_token` is included. If empty then there are no more results.
To get the next set of results, call `GetIncidents`
method again using the value of `next_page_token` as `page_token`.
For Example: 'ODFBMzQ3MDYtNzQxNy00RDZGLThDNjE1MEFDMkM4MTQ3NDQ='

id.description:
The ID of the linked inspection. This may or may not be a UUID, so we don't
validate it here.

created_at.description: The date the inspection was created.

template_title.title: The title of the template that this inspection was created from

s12.tasks.v1.Inspection.title: Inspection represents an inspection that is linked to an issue

s12.tasks.v1.Inspection.InspectionStatus.description:
- INSPECTION_STATUS_UNSPECIFIED: The status of the inspection is unspecified
 - INSPECTION_STATUS_IN_PROGRESS: The status of the inspection is 'In Progress'
 - INSPECTION_STATUS_COMPLETED: The status of the inspection is 'Completed'
 - INSPECTION_STATUS_DELETED: The status of the inspection is 'Deleted'
s12.tasks.v1.Inspection.InspectionStatus.title: The status of the linked inspection

s12.tasks.v1.MetricType.description:
- UNKNOWN_TYPE: `UNKNOWN` indicates null value
 - TEMPERATURE: Temperature metric
 - HUMIDITY: Humidity metric
 - BATTERY: Battery level. Percentage based i.e. 0 - 100
 - SIGNAL: Signal strength metric
 - AIR_QUALITY_PM25: Air quality for particulate matter less than 2.5 microns
 - AIR_QUALITY_PM10: Air quality for particulate matter less than 10 microns
 - TEMPERATURE_2: Alternative temperature (Some hardware i.e. Avem Quirks do have 2 probes
and are sending 2 temperatures)
 - DIFFERENTIAL_AIR_PRESSURE: Differential air pressure
 - CO: Carbon monoxide
 - DOOR_OPEN_CLOSED: Door open/closed boolean metric
 - BATTERY_VOLTAGE: Battery voltage metric
 - WEATHER: Weather (e.g. sunny, thunderstorms)
 - WIND_SPEED: Wind speed
 - WIND_DIRECTION: Wind direction
 - WIND_GUST: Wind gust
 - CO2: Carbon dioxide
s12.tasks.v1.MetricType.title: Metric type represents a type of received metric

s12.tasks.v1.ReferenceType.description:
Reference type. The idea here is to list all the "external" types that would
be used as a reference when creating actions.

task_id.title:
An ID uniquely identifying this task message.
For example: 'aa70d8a6-af37-44f4-8768d8899fe274c5'

template_id.title: Template ID of the inspection the action belongs to

modified_at.title: Date/time this task was last modified

completed_at.title: Date/time this task was completed at

template_name.title: Template name of the inspection the action belongs to

s12.tasks.v1.Task.title: Task represents a stand-alone task that has been created

name.description: The name of the task's location.

s12.tasks.v1.Task.AddressLocation.description:
The location of the task.
The latitude and longitude in the `geo_position` object are required.
All other fields are optional, but add extra context to the location on
platform.

note.title: Note inside Attachments of inspectionItem Answer

media.title: images or pdf inside Attachments of inspectionItem Answer

collaborator_id.description: A UUID uniquely identifying this collaborator.

s12.tasks.v1.Task.Collaborator.description:
A collaborator is somebody who is involved with the task.
They have either created the task, or are assigned to it.

id.title: The UUID uniquely identifying this contributor

s12.tasks.v1.Task.Contributor.title: The contributor that raised the issue

enable_date.title: Enable date turns on input for date values

enable_time.title: Enable date turns on input for time values

id.description: The UUID uniquely identifying this external user.

email.description: The email address of the external user.

s12.tasks.v1.Task.ExternalUser.description: The external user that is assigned to a task.

s12.tasks.v1.Task.Group.description: The group that is assigned to a task.

s12.tasks.v1.Task.IncidentContext.title: context of an incident associated with the action

inspection_id.title: ID of the inspection the action belongs to

inspection_name.title: The name of the inspection the action belongs to

s12.tasks.v1.Task.Inspection.title: The inspection data of this task

inspection_id.title: ID of the inspection associated with the action

inspection_name.title: name of the inspection associated with the action

inspection_item_id.title: ID of the inspectionItem associated with the action

inspection_item_name.title: name of the inspectionItem associated with the action

inspection_item_type.title: @deprecated The type of the inspectionItem associated with the action

inspection_item_path.title: The path(breadcrumbs) of the inspectionItem associated with the action

inspection_deleted.title: Flag indicated whether the inspection has been deleted

s12.tasks.v1.Task.InspectionContext.title: context of inspection associated with the action

inspection_item_id.title: ID of the item in the inspection associated with the action

inspection_item_name.title: The name of the item in the inspection associated with the action

inspection_item_type.title: The type of the item in the inspection associated with the action

s12.tasks.v1.Task.InspectionItem.title: The inspection item data of this task

s12.tasks.v1.Task.NumberComparison.description: Used to compare values against a single number.

lower.description: Represents the lower value of the range.

upper.description: Represents the upper value of the range.

s12.tasks.v1.Task.RangeComparison.description: Used to compare values within a range.

s12.tasks.v1.Task.Reference.title: Reference is a type/id pair defined as:

sensor_alert_id.title: ID of sensor alert context associated with the action

created_at.description: The time the alert event was created/updated.

detected_at.description: The time the first alert event was detected.

sensor_id.title: Sensor asset ID for which the event happened

site_name.title: Name of the site at a time of event

sensor_name.title: Name of the sensor at a time of event

s12.tasks.v1.Task.SensorAlertContext.title: context of sensor alert associated with the action

s12.tasks.v1.Task.SensorContext.title: context of sensor associated with the action

signed_at.title: Timestamp for when the signature answer was last updated

s12.tasks.v1.Task.SignatureAnswer.title: Signature item stores user name and an image with signature

id.description: The UUID of the site associated with this task.

name.description: The name of the site associated with this task.

region.description: The region of the site associated with the task.

area.title: The area of the site associated with the task

s12.tasks.v1.Task.Site.description: The folder (site) data of this task.

max.description:
A double representing the maximum value allowed for this item. Negatives
are allowed.

min.description:
A double representing the minimum value allowed for this item. Negatives
are allowed.

status_id.title:
An ID uniquely identifying this task status message.
For example: 'aa70d8a6-af37-44f4-8768d8899fe274c5'

key.title:
A pre-defined value that the system can use to handle
the particular label e.g. analytics, filter based on it
A key may look like: "to do" | "In progress" | "Done" | "Can't do"

label.title: A label associated with the key, typically for display purposes

display_order.title: Used to order this status when displaying a list of statuses

s12.tasks.v1.Task.SwitchAnswer.description:
Answer returned for SwitchItem, exists in old inspections
Users cant change answer to them & cant attach actions to them either.

s12.tasks.v1.Task.TextAnswer.title: Answer returned for TextItem, TextSingleItem, ScannerItem type

firstname.description: The first name of the user.

lastname.description: The last name of the user.

s12.tasks.v1.Task.User.description: The user associated to the task. They could be a creator or assignee.

item_id.title: The UUID of the timeline item

task_id.description: The UUID of the task this timeline is associated with.

timestamp.description: UTC Timestamp for the timeline item.

s12.tasks.v1.TimelineItem.description: TimelineItem contains information about each item in the timeline.

id.description: The UUID of the individual who created this timeline item.

name.description: The name of the individual who created this timeline item.

s12.tasks.v1.TimelineItem.ActivityCreato.description:
The type of individual who has created this timeline item.

 - TYPE_NOT_SET: An unknown type of creator.
 - INTERNAL_USER: The creator is an authenticated user within the organisation.
 - EXTERNAL_USER: The creator is an unauthenticated user who has been given external access
to the task.

s12.tasks.v1.TimelineItem.IncidentCreate.description: Data about when an issue was created.

question_text.description: The text of the question that was answered.

answer_text.description: The text of the answer that was provided.

s12.tasks.v1.TimelineItem.TaskAnswerAdde.description: Data about when a custom question was answered on this issue.

collaborators.description: Data about the people assigned to the task.

s12.tasks.v1.TimelineItem.TaskAssigneeAd.description: Data about when an assignee was added to the task.

assignees.description: Assignees of the task that was updated.

s12.tasks.v1.TimelineItem.TaskAssigneeUp.description: Data about when an assignee was updated.

@deprecated. Use category instead.
ID of the category of the task that was updated.
The field has been deprecated, as more information about the category is
in the `category` field.

s12.tasks.v1.TimelineItem.TaskCategoryUp.description: Data about when an issue's category was updated.

comment.description: The text value of the comment.

s12.tasks.v1.TimelineItem.TaskCommentAdd.description: Data about when a comment is added to a task.

s12.tasks.v1.TimelineItem.TaskCreatedMes.description: Data about when an action was created.

due_at.description: The new due date of the task.

s12.tasks.v1.TimelineItem.TaskDueAtUpdat.description: Data about when the due date of a task was changed.

s12.tasks.v1.TimelineItem.TaskImageUploa.description:
Data about when an image was added to a task. @deprecated
This has been deprecated in favour of media messages.
This is because the media messages allow videos and PDF as well as images.

inspection_id.title: ID of the inspection that is being added

s12.tasks.v1.TimelineItem.TaskInspection.description: Data about when an inspection is linked to this issue.

template_title.description: The title of the template this inspection was created from.

s12.tasks.v1.TimelineItem.TaskInspection.description: Data about when an inspection linked to this issue is completed.

template_title.description: The title of the template this inspection was created from.

s12.tasks.v1.TimelineItem.TaskInspection.description: Data about when an inspection linked to this issue was deleted.

s12.tasks.v1.TimelineItem.TaskLocationAd.description: Data about when a location is added to a task.

media.description:
Data about the media that were added at this time.
Users can add multiple pieces of media at once, so this may contain data
about multiple pieces of media.

s12.tasks.v1.TimelineItem.TaskMediaUploa.description: Data about when media files were added to the task.

group_id.description:
UUIDs for any groups that received a notification in this timeline item.
IDs that belong to the task's specific category. This is deprecated in
favour of the `groups` field.

groups.description: Data about any groups who received a notification in this timeline item.

users.description:
Data about any individual users who received a notification in this
timeline item.

external_users.description:
Data about any external users who received a notification in this
timeline item.

site_groups.description: Groups that received a notification due to site based notification configuration.

s12.tasks.v1.TimelineItem.TaskNotificati.description: Data about when a notification is sent about a task.

priority_id.description: The new priority UUID of the task.

s12.tasks.v1.TimelineItem.TaskPriorityUp.description: Data about when the priority of a task was updated.

site_hierarchy.description:
Information about the hierarchy of the site.
This is ordered in ascending order, ie: Site -> Area -> Region -> State -> Country.

s12.tasks.v1.TimelineItem.TaskSiteUpdate.description: Data about when the folder (site) of this task was updated.

status_id.description: The new status UUID of the task.

s12.tasks.v1.TimelineItem.TaskStatusUpda.description: Data about when the status of a task was updated.

s12.tasks.v1.TimelineItem.Type.description:
The type of the timeline item.

 - TIMELINE_ITEM_UNKNOWN: Removed fields related to the cancelled actions/issues integration
An unknown type of timeline item.
 - TASK_CREATED: A timeline item for the creation of an action.
 - TASK_TITLE_UPDATED: A timeline item indicating that the title of the task has been updated.
 - TASK_DESCRIPTION_UPDATED: A timeline item indicating that the task's description has been updated.
 - TASK_ASSIGNEE_ADDED: A timeline item indicating that an assignee has been added to the task.
 - TASK_ASSIGNEE_REMOVED: A timeline item indicating that an assignee has been removed from the
task.
 - TASK_DUE_AT_UPDATED: A timeline item indicating that the due date of the task has been
updated.
 - TASK_STATUS_UPDATED: A timeline item indicating that the status of the task has been updated.
 - TASK_PRIORITY_UPDATED: A timeline item indicating that the priority of the task has been
updated.
 - TASK_COMMENT_ADDED: A timeline item indicating that a comment has been added to the task.
 - TASK_IMAGE_UPLOADED: A timeline item indicating that an image was added to the task.
This field is deprecated, and was replaced by the `TASK_MEDIA_ADDED`
type. It is kept here to maintain backwards compatibility.
 - TASK_SITE_UPDATED: A timeline item indicating that the folder (site) of the task has been
updated.
 - TASK_DELETED: A timeline item indicating that this task has been deleted.
 - TASK_CATEGORY_UPDATED: A timeline item indicating that the category of this task has been
updated. This type is only relevant to issues.
 - INCIDENT_CREATED: A timeline item for the creation of an issue.
 - TASK_NOTIFICATION_SENT: A timeline item indicating that a notification about this task has been
sent.
 - TASK_MEDIA_UPLOADED: A timeline item indicating that media has been added to this task.
 - TASK_ASSIGNEE_UPDATED: reserved 17, 18, 19;
17 - 19 reserved for the cancelled actions/issues integration feature.
A timeline item indicating that the assignee of this task has been
updated.
 - TASK_LOCATION_ADDED: A timeline item indicating the geolocation of this issue.
This type is only relevant to issues.
 - TASK_INSPECTION_COMPLETED: A timeline item indicating that an inspection that has been linked to an
issue has been completed. This type is only relevant to issues.
 - TASK_INSPECTION_DELETED: A timeline item indicating that an inspection that has been linked to an
issue has been deleted. This type is only relevant to issues.
 - TASK_INSPECTION_ADDED: A timeline item indicating that an inspection has been linked to an
issue. This type is only relevant to issues.
 - TASK_ANSWER_ADDED: A timeline item indicating that an issue's custom question has been
answered. This type is only relevant to issues.
